intro: Linanthus croceus, commonly known as the yellow linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Evening Primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, linear leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Linanthus croceus is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
